Source: Adapted from Marion Goosens, “Schilders en de markt: Haarlem 1605–1635,” Ph.D. dissertation, Leiden University, 2001, 346–347.
content.question: Which of the following developments in the Dutch Republic most directly encouraged the collection of paintings such as those described in the table?

choices.label: Prosperity as a result of innovations in banking and finance
The arrival in the Dutch Republic of many Protestants fleeing persecution in other countries
New scientific developments that led to an increasingly secular outlook
The growing influence of Romantic ideas concerning the spiritual value of nature

content.answer: Prosperity as a result of innovations in banking and finance

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
